articles.title: EU und Russland: EU-Staaten einigen sich auf neues Sanktionspaket gegen Russland
articles.teaser: Kurz vor dem EU-Gipfel haben sich die Mitgliedsstaaten auf weitere Sanktionen gegen Russland geeinigt. Damit sollen Russlands Finanzierungsmöglichkeiten begrenzt werden.
articles.image_title: EU und Russland: A Gazprom gas station operated by the Petroleum Industry of Serbia (NIS) is pictured in Belgrade on October 9, 2025, as the United States introduces sanctions on Serbia's majority Russian-owned NIS oil company, which operates the country's only refinery. The United States sanctioned the company, Petroleum Industry of Serbia (NIS), in January as part of its crackdown on the Russian energy sector following Moscow's invasion of Ukraine in 2022. After the sanctions came into force on October 9, 2025 morning, NIS said it "had not yet been granted an extension of the special licence from the United States Department of the Treasury".NIS is 45-percent owned by Russia's Gazprom Neft

A pro-government camp outside of Serbia's national parliament caught fire on October 22, 2025, with reports of loud bangs and police with guns drawn swarming the area in videos posted online. The blaze was quickly extinguished by firefighters, with the charred remains of the tent visible from a police blockade near the scene, according to an AFP reporter. The cause of the fire was not immediately known, but bangs could be heard in one video posted online which appeared to show the scene. articles.image_title: Hamburg-Podcast "Elbvertiefung": HAMBURG, GERMANY - APRIL 04: The Elbtower high rise stands partially complete on April 04, 2025 in Hamburg, Germany. Construction of the prestige building, designed by David Chipperfield Architects, was halted in 2023 following the bankruptcy of billionaire investor Rene Benko. articles.image_title: Organtransplantation: Surgeon Mario Alvarez Maestro (R) and an assistant prepare a kidney for a renal transplantation on patient Juan Benito Druet at La Paz hospital in Madrid on February 28, 2017 . Doctors in Spain performed 4,818 transplants on 2016, including 2,994 kidney transplants, according to the health ministry's National Transplant Organisation (ONT). That means there were 43.4 organ donors per million inhabitants last year, a world record, up from 40.2 donors in 2015. By comparison in the United States there were just 28.2 donors per million inhabitants in 2015, in France there were 28.1 donors and in Germany there were 10.9 donors, according to the Council of Europe. / AFP PHOTO / PIERRE-PHILIPPE MARCOU (Photo credit should read PIERRE-PHILIPPE MARCOU/AFP via Getty Images)
